solution.text:
Given equation : \(3x^2 - _{{6*l}}_x + _{{(l*l*3)-(k*k*3)}}_ = 0\)
Note that the coefficient of \(x^2\) is not a perfect square. So, we divide the equation throughout by 3 to get:
\(x^2 - _{{2*l}}_x + _{{(l*l)-(k*k)}}_ = 0\)
Now,
Follow the process as follows:
\(x^2 - _{{2*l}}_x + _{{(l*l)-(k*k)}}_\) = \((x)^2 - _{l}_x - _{l}_x + _{{l*l}}_ - _{{l*l}}_ + _{{(l*l)-(k*k)}}_\)
i.e., \(x(x - _{l}_) - _{l}_(x - _{l}_) -_{{k*k}}_ \)
i.e., \((x - _{l}_)\times (x - _{l}_) -_{{k*k}}_ \)
i.e., \((x - _{l}_)^2 -_{{k*k}}_ \)
\(x^2 - _{{2*l}}_x + _{{(l*l)-(k*k)}}_ = (x - _{l}_)^2 -_{{k*k}}_ = 0\)
i.e., \((x - _{l}_)^2 = _{{k*k}}_\)
i.e., \((x - _{l}_) = \pm_{k}_\)
i.e., x = _{l}_ + _{k}_=_{{l+k}}_ and x = _{l}_ - _{k}_=_{{l-k}}_

content.text: Find the roots of \(3x^2 - _{{6*l}}_x + _{{(3*l*l)-(k*k*3)}}_ = 0\) by the method of completing the square.
